docs.snippet: Sharp increases in Italian duties on aluminum, aluminum alloys and its manufactures went into effect on Monday, according to the weekly summary of foreign tariff changes issued yesterday by the Department of Commerce.

headline.main: SLUMP HURTS BONDS OF LATIN AMERICA; Defaults by Bolivia, Chile and Peru Linked by Bankers With Drop in Commodity Prices. ARGENTINA BELIEVED SOUND Creation of Central Bank Urged for Brazil--Cuban Situation Causes Little Concern. Delay in Chile. SLUMP HURTS BONDS OF LATIN AMERICA

docs.snippet: EXPORTS of radio apparatus from the United States were valued  at $1,581,140 for last June, which is a gain of $214,181 over last year, according to the Department of Commerce. The total value for the sixmonth period ended June 30, 1931, amounted to...
docs.lead_paragraph: EXPORTS of radio apparatus from the United States were valued at $1,581,140 for last June, which is a gain of $214,181 over last year, according to the Department of Commerce. The total value for the sixmonth period ended June 30, 1931, amounted to $9,748,873, or a gain of $1,220,600.

headline.main: RADIO EXPORTS SHOT AN INCREASE; LATIN AMERICA RAISES THE TARIFF
